alert.note: Alert for Dawes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Box Butte, Dawes and northeastern Sioux Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whitney Lake, or 11 miles west of Chadron, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chadron, Crawford, Chadron Campground, Whitney Lake, Box Butte Campground, Red Cloud Campground, Chadron Airport, Whitney, Marsland, Fort Robinson and Chadron St Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
